tools.name: CreateEvent
tools.description:
Create an event in the authenticated user's default calendar.

Ignores timezone offsets provided in the start_date_time and end_date_time parameters.
Instead, uses the user's default calendar timezone to filter events.
If the user has not set a timezone for their calendar, then the timezone will be UTC.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The text of the event's subject (title) line.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of the event

parameters.name: start_date_time
parameters.description: The datetime of the event's start, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-25T13:00:00

parameters.name: end_date_time
parameters.description: The datetime of the event's end, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-25T13:30:00

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location of the event

parameters.name: attendee_emails
parameters.description: The email addresses of the attendees of the event. Must be valid email addresses e.g., username@domain.com.

parameters.name: is_online_meeting
parameters.description: Whether the event is an online meeting. Defaults to False

parameters.name: custom_meeting_url
parameters.description: The URL of the online meeting. If not provided and is_online_meeting is True, then a url will be generated for you

output.description: A dictionary containing the created event details

body.value: Discuss project updates and action items.

List the user's emails in the specified folder.

Exactly one of `well_known_folder_name` or `folder_id` MUST be provided.

tools.name: ListEventsInTimeRange
tools.description:
List events in the user's calendar in a specific time range.

Ignores timezone offsets provided in the start_date_time and end_date_time parameters.
Instead, uses the user's default calendar timezone to filter events.
If the user has not set a timezone for their calendar, then the timezone will be UTC.

parameters.name: start_date_time
parameters.description: The start date and time of the time range, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-24T19:00:00

parameters.name: end_date_time
parameters.description: The end date and time of the time range, represented in ISO 8601 format. Timezone offset is ignored. For example, 2025-04-24T19:30:00

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of events to return. Max 1000. Defaults to 10

output.description: A dictionary containing a list of events

tools.name: UpdateDraftEmail
tools.description:
Update an existing draft email in Outlook.

This tool overwrites the subject and body of a draft email (if provided),
and modifies its recipient lists by selectively adding or removing email addresses.

This tool can update any un-sent email:
    - draft
    - reply-draft
    - reply-all draft
    - forward draft

parameters.name: message_id
parameters.description: The ID of the draft email to update

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The new subject of the draft email. If provided, the existing subject will be overwritten

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The new body of the draft email. If provided, the existing body will be overwritten

parameters.name: to_add
parameters.description: Email addresses to add as 'To' recipients.

parameters.name: to_remove
parameters.description: Email addresses to remove from the current 'To' recipients.

parameters.name: cc_add
parameters.description: Email addresses to add as 'CC' recipients.

parameters.name: cc_remove
parameters.description: Email addresses to remove from the current 'CC' recipients.

parameters.name: bcc_add
parameters.description: Email addresses to add as 'BCC' recipients.

parameters.name: bcc_remove
parameters.description: Email addresses to remove from the current 'BCC' recipients.

output.description: A dictionary containing the updated email details

summary:
# Microsoft Arcade Toolkit
The Microsoft Arcade toolkit provides seamless integration with Outlook Mail, enabling developers to create and manage emails and calendar events efficiently.

## Capabilities
- Create, send, and manage emails and drafts.
- Organize and filter calendar events based on user-defined parameters.
- Retrieve, update, and reply to existing emails easily.
- Access user mailbox across all folders, enhancing email management.

## OAuth
Auth type: oauth2; Provider: Microsoft; Scopes: Calendars.ReadBasic, Calendars.ReadWrite, Mail.Read, Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.Send, MailboxSettings.Read.

## Secrets
No secrets are required for the use of this toolkit.
